TITLE.P: The Pre-Flight Message Test Facility (PFMTF) at the Joint Electronic Warfare Operational Support Centre (JEWOSC) requires regular maintenance and repair services

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Pre-Flight Message Test Facility (PFMTF) at the Joint Electronic Warfare Operational Support Centre (JEWOSC) requires regular maintenance and repair services, including updates to the software as required.

The Authority has a requirement to provide a 4-year contract to support the Pre-Flight Message Test Facility at the Joint Electronic Warfare Operational Support Centre to support the Wildcat. The requirement is for Repair services including updates to the software as required:

HELSS/0073 is subject to DEFCON 658 - Cyber and DEFSTAN 05-138 - Cyber Security for Defence Suppliers. A Cyber Risk Assessment has been carried out by the Project Team and a risk level of Low has been identified (Reference: RAR-ANCX42AX).

In order for a supplier to demonstrate their compliance MOD has created Octavian. This is an online tool that enables suppliers to complete a supplier assurance questionnaire (SAQ). Further information on compliance with the Defence Cyber Protection Partnership.

INFO_ADD.P: All values stated in this VEAT are provisional only. The Contract has not been awarded.

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: The Defence Equipment & Support Lynx-Wildcat Team, part of the UK Ministry of Defence (MoD), intends to award a four year contract to Leonardo MW Ltd (Leonardo Airborne & Space Systems Division) to support the Pre-Flight Message Test Facility (PFMTF) at the Joint Electronic Warfare Operational Support Centre (JEWOSC) to support the Wildcat Helicopter fleet.
The MoD’s requirement is for Maintenance and Repair services including updates to the software as required:

It is considered that the contract can be placed using the negotiated procedure without prior publication of a contract notice pursuant to Article 28(1)(e) of Directive 2009/81/EC (Regulation 16 (1)(a)(ii) of the UK Defence and Security Public Contracts Regulation 2011) for technical reasons. This is on the basis that only Leonardo MW Ltd, as the Original Equipment Manufacturer:
1) Have access to the technical data needed to carry out these support services;
2) Have the specialist knowledge and experience of the PFMTF and Sky Guardian 2000 Radar Warning Receiver (which the test facility supports,) required to provide these support services, and,
3) Are capable of manufacturing and providing Spares to the PFMTF which is a complex and bespoke test facility.
